page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: WHEN BASILDON WAS ORIGINALLY PLANNED, IT WA DIVIDED UP INTO NEIGHBOURHOODS AND EACH ONE HAD A PRIMARY SCHOOL, AND A SECONDARY SCHOOL. AS THER TOWN GREW THEY SCHOOLS WERE BURSTING AT THE SEEMS. MOST OF THEM HAD EXTRA WOODEN CLASSROOMS PUT IN THE PLAYGROUND. OUR SCHOOL HAD TEN CLASSROOMS INTO THE ORGINAL BRICK BUILDING, BUT WHEN WE WERE AT AT BIGGEST, WE HAD SEVEN EXTRA WOODEN CLASSROOMS ALL AROUND THE PLACE. WE ARE NOW HALF THAT SIZE AND ONLY HAVE EIGHT CLASSES. MANY OF THE SCHOOLS ARE CLOSING AS THERE ARE NOT ENOUGH PUPILS. SOME INFANT AND JUNIOR SCHOLS ARE COMBINING TO MAKE ONE PROMARY SCHOOL, AND THE EMPTY BUILDING IS BEING USED FOR SOMETHING ELSE, LIKE THE EDUCATION OFFICE, OLD PEOPLES DAY CENTRE, AND A SCHOOL FOR CHILDREN WHO ARE DISRUPTIVE.
